Therefore justice is far from us, / And righteousness does not overtake us; / We look eagerly for light, but, ah, darkness, / For brightness, [i]but[/i] we walk in gloom.

We [xref]a[/xref]grope like [xref]b[/xref]blind men at the wall; / We grope like those without eyes; / We stumble at midday as [i]we would[/i] at dusk; / Among the [note]1[/note]prospering we are like dead men.
verse.note: The meaning of the word is uncertain. Others understand, desolate places; i.e., cemeteries.

verse.text: All of us roar like bears / And moan incessantly like doves; / We look eagerly for justice, but there is none, / For salvation, [i]but[/i] it is far from us.

For our transgressions are multiplied before You, / And our sins respond [i]to You[/i] against us; / For our transgressions are with us, / And as for our iniquities, we know [i]what[/i] they [i]are:[/i]
Transgressing and denying Jehovah, / And turning away from our God; / Speaking oppression and revolt, / Conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
And justice is turned back, / And righteousness stands far off; / For truth has stumbled in the street, / And uprightness cannot come in.
And truth is lacking, / And he who turns from evil becomes plunder.[separator]And Jehovah saw [i]it,[/i] and it was evil in His sight / That there was no justice.

And He saw that there was [xref]a[/xref]no man, / And He was [xref]b[/xref]appalled that there was no intercessor. / Therefore His [note]1[/note][xref]c[/xref]arm accomplished salvation for Him, / And His righteousness sustained Him.
verse.note: See note [link]9[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 51[/link].

verse.text: Thus He put on righteousness as a [xref]a[/xref]breastplate, / And a [xref]b[/xref]helmet of salvation upon His head; / And He put on the garments of vengeance for clothing / And wrapped Himself with zeal as a mantle.
According to [i]their[/i] dealings, so will He repay: / Wrath to His adversaries, recompense to His enemies; / To the coastlands He will repay with recompense.

So they will fear the name of Jehovah from the west, / And His glory from the [xref]a[/xref]rising of the sun; / When the adversary comes like a flood, / The Spirit of Jehovah will lift up a standard against him.
[xref]a[/xref]And a [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]Redeemer will come to Zion, / And unto those who turn from transgression in Jacob, / Declares Jehovah.
verse.note: As the Servant of Jehovah, Christ will also be a Redeemer to Zion. Christ can redeem the corrupted Israel because He is the sure mercies covenanted to them ([link]55:3[/link]).

verse.text: And as for Me, this is My [note]1[/note]covenant with them, says Jehovah: My [note]2[/note][xref]a[/xref]Spirit which is upon you and My [note]2[/note][xref]b[/xref]words which I have put in your mouth shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your seed, nor from the mouth of your seed's seed, says Jehovah, from now and forever.
verse.note: This covenant is Christ, who is the reality and surety of the covenant ([link]42:6[/link]; [link]49:8[/link]; [link]54:10[/link]). See note [link]6[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 42[/link].

Christ as the Redeemer ([link]v. 20[/link]) saves us from our sins, iniquities, and transgressions, whereas Christ as the all-inclusive life-giving Spirit ([link]1 Cor. 15:45[/link]) is for our breathing ([link]John 20:22[/link]), and Christ as the word ([link]Rev. 19:13[/link]) is for our feeding ([link]Matt. 4:4[/link]; [link]John 6:57[/link], [link]63[/link]) and our speaking ([link]1 Cor. 14:31[/link]; [link]Eph. 4:29[/link]).

verse.text: Arise! [xref]a[/xref]Shine! For your [note]1[/note]light has come, / And the [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]glory of Jehovah has risen upon you.
verse.note: Christ as the Servant of Jehovah is the light of Israel and the glory of Jehovah rising upon Israel at His return ([link]vv. 1-3[/link]). The entire earth today, including Israel, is under darkness. But when Christ comes as a Redeemer to Israel ([link]59:20[/link]), He will be their light to enlighten them, which light is the glory of God, i.e., God Himself in His glory (cf. [link]Rev. 21:23[/link]; [link]22:5[/link]).

verse.text: For, behold, the [xref]a[/xref]darkness will cover the earth, / And deep darkness the peoples; / But Jehovah will rise upon you, / And His glory will be seen upon you.
And nations will come to your [xref]a[/xref]light, / And kings to the brightness of your [note]1[/note]rising.
verse.note: Today the nation of Israel is suffering under the pressure of the nations, but when Christ returns, Israel will rise up. When Christ comes back as the saving Redeemer, Israel as God's elect and as the center of the world's population will be restored in every respect. At that time, all the Gentile nations will be for Israel ([link]vv. 3-14[/link]).

verse.text: Lift up your eyes around [i]you[/i] and see: / They all [xref]a[/xref]gather together; they come to you; / Your sons will come from far away, / And your daughters will be carried on the hip.

Then you will see and you will beam, / And your heart will be in awe and will swell [i]with joy,[/i] / For the abundance of the sea will be turned to you, / The [xref]a[/xref]wealth of the nations will come to you.

A multitude of camels will cover you, / The young camels of Midian and Ephah; / All those from Sheba will come; / They will carry [xref]a[/xref]gold and frankincense, / And they will bear the good news of Jehovah's praises.
All the flocks of Kedar will be gathered together to you; / The rams of Nebaioth will minister to you; / They will go up acceptably upon My altar, / And I will beautify the house of My beauty.
Who are these who fly like a cloud, / And like the doves to their dovecote?

Surely the coastlands will look eagerly for Me; / And the ships of Tarshish will come first, / To bring your children from afar, / Their silver and their gold with them, / Unto the name of Jehovah your God / And unto the Holy One of Israel; for He has beautified you.
And the children of foreigners will build up your walls, / And their kings will minister to you; / For in My wrath I struck you, / But in My favor I had compassion on you.

And your gates will be open continually; / They will [xref]a[/xref]not be closed day or night, / So that they may bring to you the [xref]b[/xref]wealth of the nations / And their kings being led in procession.
For the nation and the kingdom that will not serve you will [xref]a[/xref]perish, and the nations will be utterly wasted.

The [note]1[/note]glory of Lebanon will come to you, / The fir tree, the pine tree, and the box tree together, / To beautify the place of My sanctuary; / And I will make the place for My [xref]a[/xref]feet glorious.
verse.note: [i]Glory[/i] here refers to the products of the nations ([link]Gen. 31:1[/link], [link]16[/link]; [link]Esth. 1:4[/link]).

verse.text: And the sons of those who afflicted you / Will come [xref]a[/xref]bowing down to you, / And all those who despised you will bow down / At the soles of your feet; / And they will call you the City of Jehovah, / The [xref]b[/xref]Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
Whereas you have been forsaken and hated, / So that no one would pass through you, / I will make you an eternal excellency, / A joy from generation to generation.
And you will suck the milk of nations / And suck the breast of [xref]a[/xref]kings; / Thus you will know that I, Jehovah, am your Savior / And your [xref]b[/xref]Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

Instead of bronze I will bring gold, / And instead of iron I will bring silver; / And instead of wood [i]there will be[/i] bronze, / And instead of stones [i]there will be[/i] iron; / And I will make peace your officers, / And righteousness your rulers.
Violence will no longer be heard in your land, / Nor desolation and destruction within your borders; / But you will call your [xref]a[/xref]walls Salvation, / And your gates Praise.

You will no longer have the [xref]a[/xref]sun for [i]your[/i] light by day, / Nor for brightness will the moon give you light; / But Jehovah will be an eternal [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]light to you, / And your God your [note]2[/note]beauty.
verse.note: In the New Jerusalem Israel will enjoy Jehovah in Christ, the Servant of Jehovah, as the eternal light ([link]vv. 19-20[/link]; [link]Rev. 21:23[/link]; [link]22:5[/link]).

In the restoration God in Christ will be Israel's glory and beauty, and Israel will be God's glory and beauty ([link]v. 21[/link]; [link]61:3b[/link]). Thus, God and His chosen people will be glorified and beautified in mutuality. This will be accomplished by the divine dispensing through Christ as the Redeemer and the Savior putting Himself into God's people as the life-giving Spirit and the word ([link]59:21[/link]).

verse.text: Your sun will no longer go down, / Nor will your moon withdraw; / For Jehovah will be an eternal light to you, / And the days of your mourning will be ended.
Then all your people will be righteous; / They will possess the land forever, / The branch of My [xref]a[/xref]planting, / The works of My hands, / That I may be [note]1[/note]beautified.
verse.note: See note [link]19[sup]2[/sup][/link].

verse.text: The least one will become a thousand, / And the smallest a strong nation. / I, Jehovah, will hasten it in its time.

[note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]The [xref]b[/xref]Spirit of the [note]2[/note]Lord Jehovah is upon Me, / Because Jehovah has [xref]c[/xref]anointed Me / To bring [xref]d[/xref]good news to the afflicted; / He has sent Me to [xref]e[/xref]bind up [i]the wounds[/i] of the brokenhearted, / To proclaim [xref]f[/xref]liberty to the captives, / And the opening [i]of the eyes[/i] to those who are bound;
verse.note: [link]Verses 1-3[/link] refer to the ministry of Christ as the Anointed of Jehovah in His two comings. As indicated in [link]Luke 4:16-22a[/link] (see notes there), [link book="Isa." chapter="60"]vv. 1-2a[/link] in this chapter refer to Christ in His first coming, in which His ministry was to announce the gospel of grace. [link]Verses 2b-3[/link] refer to Christ in His second coming, in which His ministry will be to avenge Israel that they may be restored. The prophecy concerning Christ as the Anointed of Jehovah was fulfilled as a foretaste at Christ's first coming, for the age of grace as the acceptable year of Jehovah, the New Testament jubilee (see note [link]10[sup]1[/sup], par. 2, in Lev. 25[/link]), resulting in the producing and building up of the church. This prophecy will be fulfilled as a full taste at Christ's second coming, for the restoration of Israel unto the new heavens and new earth ([link]65:17[/link]; [link]66:22[/link]).[br][br]Christ's coming is of two parts and at two times. In His first coming, Christ came to minister, to dispense, Himself into His followers. In this way He carried out the New Testament ministry to dispense the Triune God into the disciples under His ministry, most of whom were Jews. This ministry in Christ's first coming laid a solid foundation for His second coming. When He comes the second time, He will come mainly in an outward way to rescue Israel from their circumstances and to bring in their restoration ([link]Zech. 12-14[/link]). This restoration will be expanded to include all things created by God ([link]2:2-5[/link]; [link]11:6-9[/link]; [link]30:26[/link]; [link]35:1-10[/link]; [link]65:25[/link]). It will last for a millennium, for the thousand-year kingdom ([link]Rev. 20:2-7[/link]).[br][br]In the eyes of God, Christ's two comings are two aspects of one unique coming of Christ from God to mankind. Hence, in Isaiah's prophecy these two comings are like two mountain peaks which, when viewed from a distance, seem to be one peak. For this reason Isaiah viewed Christ's first coming and second coming as being together.

The Spirit of Jehovah was upon Christ in His first coming ([link]Matt. 3:16[/link]; [link]Luke 4:18a[/link]) and will be upon Him in His second coming. When the Lord Jesus comes the second time, the striking significance will be that the Spirit of the Lord Jehovah is upon Him, the word [i]Lord[/i] being especially added here by Isaiah.

verse.text: To proclaim the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]acceptable year of Jehovah / And the [note]1[/note]day of vengeance of our God; / To [xref]b[/xref]comfort all who mourn;
verse.note: The acceptable year is toward God's people (cf. [link]Luke 4:18-19[/link]); the day of vengeance is toward the enemies of God's people. When Christ comes again to Israel, that will be the acceptable year to them and also the day of God's vengeance over the enemies of God's people, Antichrist and his followers ([link]Rev. 19:11-21[/link]).

verse.text: To grant to those who mourn in Zion, / To give to them a headdress instead of ashes, / The oil of gladness instead of [xref]a[/xref]mourning, / The mantle of praise instead of a spirit of heaviness; / That they may be called the terebinths of righteousness, / The [xref]b[/xref]planting of Jehovah, that He may be glorified.
And they will [xref]a[/xref]rebuild the ancient ruins; / They will raise up the former desolations; / And they will repair the cities of waste, / The desolations of generation upon generation.
And strangers will stand and feed your flocks, / And the sons of the foreigner will be your plowmen and vinedressers.

But you will be called the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]priests of Jehovah; / [i]People[/i] will speak of you as the ministers of our God. / You will eat the [xref]b[/xref]wealth of nations, / And you will boast in their glory.
verse.note: In the restoration Israel will be priests of Jehovah (see note [link]3[sup]2[/sup] in ch. 2[/link]), the ministers of their God, and the Gentiles will be the laborers to serve Israel ([link]vv. 4-9[/link]).

verse.text: Instead of your shame [i]there will be[/i] a double [i]portion,[/i] / And [i]instead[/i] of humiliation they will give a ringing shout for their portion. / Therefore in their land they will possess double; / Eternal joy will be theirs.

For I, Jehovah, love [xref]a[/xref]justice; / I hate robbery [note]1[/note]with wrong; / And I will faithfully give [i]them[/i] their recompense, / And I will make an eternal [xref]b[/xref]covenant with them.
verse.note: According to the reading of some MSS and the ancient versions; other MSS read, in the burnt offering.

verse.text: Then their seed will be known among the nations, / And their offspring in the midst of the peoples; / All who see them will acknowledge them, / That they are the seed whom Jehovah has blessed.

I will rejoice greatly in Jehovah, / My soul will exult in my God; / For He has clothed me with the garments of salvation, / He has wrapped me with the robe of righteousness; / [i]I am[/i] like a bridegroom who wears the headdress of the priest, / And like a [xref]a[/xref]bride who adorns herself with her jewels.

For as the earth brings forth its sprout, / And as the garden causes the things sown in it to spring up, / So will the Lord Jehovah cause righteousness and praise / To spring up before all the nations.

For Zion's sake I will not keep silent, / And for Jerusalem's sake I will not be quiet, / Until her [note]1[/note]righteousness goes forth like brightness, / And her [note]1[/note]salvation like a burning torch.
verse.note: God's righteousness brings in His salvation (cf. [link]56:1[/link]; [link]61:10[/link]). Because righteousness will be dispensed, transfused, into the Jews during the restoration, they will shine forth righteousness. Also they will show forth salvation as God's crown of beauty and delight ([link]vv. 1-5[/link]). Their shining forth will be such a crown to God. God will be beautified by and will be happy and satisfied with what Israel will shine forth.

verse.text: And the nations will see your righteousness, / And all the kings, your glory; / And you will be called by a new name, / Which the mouth of Jehovah will designate.
You will also be a crown of beauty in the hand of Jehovah, / And a royal turban in the palm of your God.

And it will no longer be said to you, Forsaken! / Nor to your land will it be said any longer, Desolate! / But you will be called, My delight is in her, / And your land, Married; / For Jehovah delights in you, / And your land will be married.
For [i]as[/i] a young man marries a virgin, / Your sons will marry you; / And with the joy of the bridegroom over the bride / Your God will rejoice over you.
Upon your walls, O Jerusalem, / I have appointed watchmen; / All day and all night / They will never keep silent. / You who remind Jehovah, / Do not be dumb;
And do not give Him quiet / Until He establishes / And until He makes Jerusalem / A [note]1[/note]praise in the earth.
verse.note: In the restoration Jerusalem will be established and made a praise in the earth ([link]vv. 6-9[/link]).

verse.text: Jehovah has sworn by His right hand / And by His strong arm: / Surely I will never again give your grain / As food for your enemies, / And surely the children of the foreigner will not drink your new wine / For which you have labored;
But they who have gathered it will eat it, / And they will praise Jehovah, / And they who have collected it will drink it / In the courts of My holiness.
Go through, go through the gates; / Prepare the way for the people; / Cast up, cast up the highway; / Free [i]it[/i] of stones; / Raise up a [note]1[/note]standard for the peoples.
verse.note: At His return Christ will be a standard raised up for the gathering of Jehovah's scattered people. He will also be the salvation that comes to Zion to rescue her from the destruction of Antichrist and the nations that are with him ([link]v. 11b[/link]; [link]63:1-6[/link]; [link]Zech. 12:2-9[/link]; [link]Rev. 19:11-21[/link]).

verse.text: See, Jehovah has announced / To the end of the earth: / Say to the daughter of Zion, / Your salvation is now coming; / Now His reward is with Him / And His recompense before Him.
And they will call them, The holy people, / The redeemed of Jehovah; / And you will be called, Sought after! / A city not forsaken!

[note]1[/note]Who is this who comes from Edom / With [xref]a[/xref]red-stained garments, from [xref]b[/xref]Bozrah? / This One who is majestic in His apparel, / Marching in the greatness of His strength? / It is I who speak in righteousness, / Mighty to save.
verse.note: In [link]vv. 1-6[/link], [link]9[/link]; [link]64:1[/link]; [link]65:17-25[/link]; and [link]66:15-16[/link], [link]22[/link], Christ is the Angel of the presence of Jehovah ([link]v. 9[/link]) for dealing with the nations. He will rend the heavens and come to save Israel from the nations ([link]v. 9[/link]; [link]64:1[/link]). He will come with fire to judge the nations on the whole earth with His burning ([link]66:15-16a[/link]). He will also come to tread the great winepress, to destroy Antichrist and the evil people of the nations at Armageddon ([link]vv. 1-6[/link]; [link]Rev. 16:12-16[/link]; [link]19:19-21[/link]). Finally, when Christ returns He will bring in the time of restoration — the millennial kingdom unto the new heavens and new earth ([link]65:17-25[/link]; [link]66:22[/link]; [link]Rev. 20:4-6[/link]; [link]22:1[/link]).

verse.text: Why are you red in apparel, / And your garments like those of him who treads in the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]winepress?
verse.note: [i]Winepress[/i] here and in [link]Rev. 14:19-20[/link] and [link]19:15[/link] refers to the war at Armageddon. Christ as the Anointed of Jehovah will come to tread the winepress to save Israel from the nations ([link]vv. 1-6[/link]). During the last three and a half years of this age, the time of the great tribulation ([link]Matt. 24:21[/link]), Antichrist will persecute the Jews to the uttermost, with the intention of completely destroying Israel. Prior to that time, nearly all Israel will be brought back to the Holy Land. Then, before the tribulation Antichrist will make a seven-year covenant of peace with Israel so that they may have their freedom ([link]Dan. 9:27[/link]). But after three and a half years, Antichrist will change his mind and will oppose every kind of religion ([link]Dan. 11:36[/link]). After destroying Catholicism ([link]Rev. 17:16-18[/link]), Antichrist will attempt to destroy the Jewish religion. At the end of the last three and a half years, Antichrist will cause the armies of the nations to surround Jerusalem. With Jerusalem as the center, the entire region from Bozrah to the Mount of Megiddo (Armageddon — [link]Rev. 16:16[/link]) will be occupied by armies. In His coming back, Christ, with His overcomers as His bride, will descend to Bozrah ([link]v. 1[/link]), and beginning there He will tread the winepress, destroying all the armies. In this way He will rescue Israel from destruction. See [link]Rev. 14:17-20[/link]; [link]16:16[/link]; and [link]19:11-21[/link], and notes on those verses.

verse.text: I have trodden the wine trough alone, / And from the peoples there was no man with Me. / And I trod them in My anger / And trampled them in My wrath; / And their lifeblood is sprinkled on My garments, / And I have stained all My apparel.
For the [xref]a[/xref]day of recompense was in My heart, / And the year of My redemption had come.

And I [xref]a[/xref]looked and there was no one to help; / And I was appalled that there was no one to uphold. / Therefore My own [xref]b[/xref]arm accomplished salvation for Me, / And My wrath, it upheld Me.
And I trod down the peoples in My anger / And made them drunk in My wrath, / And I poured out their lifeblood upon the earth.

I will make mention of the lovingkindnesses of Jehovah, / The praises of Jehovah, / According to all that Jehovah has bestowed on us / And the great goodness toward the house of Israel, / Which He has bestowed on them according to His compassions / And according to the multitude of His lovingkindnesses.
For He said, Surely, they are My people, / Children who will not deal falsely; / So He became their Savior.

In all their affliction He was afflicted, / And the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Angel of His presence saved them; / In His love and in His mercy / He redeemed them, / And He [xref]b[/xref]bore them up and carried them / All the days of old.
verse.note: This is Christ as the Angel of Jehovah. The expression [i]the Angel of His presence[/i] indicates that this very angel is the presence of Jehovah. Christ as the Angel of Jehovah was always present with Israel in their sufferings, from [link]Exo. 3[/link] through [link]Isa. 63[/link] to [link]Zech. 1[/link]. [i]The Anointed of Jehovah[/i] (cf. [link]61:1-3[/link]) is a sweet term to God's people, but [i]the Angel of His presence[/i] is a term applied mainly toward the enemies of God's people. It is the Angel of Jehovah, the Lord Jesus as the presence of the Triune God, who will come to defeat Antichrist and his armies at Armageddon ([link]vv. 1-6[/link]).

verse.text: But they rebelled and [xref]a[/xref]grieved / His [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]Spirit of holiness; / Therefore He turned to become their enemy; / He fought against them.
verse.note: See note [link]11[sup]2[/sup] in Psa. 51[/link]. So also for [link]v. 11[/link].

verse.text: [note]1[/note]Then He remembered the days of old, Moses [i]and[/i] His people: / Where is He who [xref]a[/xref]brought them up out of the sea / With the [note]2[/note]shepherds of His flock? / Where is He who put [xref]b[/xref]in their midst / His Spirit of holiness;
verse.note: Or, Then His people remembered the days of old of Moses.
Others read, shepherd.

verse.text: Who made His glorious arm / Go at the right hand of Moses; / Who [xref]a[/xref]divided the waters before them, / To make for Himself a name forever;
Who led them through the [xref]a[/xref]depths, / Like a horse in the wilderness, / [i]And[/i] they did not stumble?
Like the cattle which go down into the valley, / The Spirit of Jehovah caused them to rest. / Thus did You lead Your people, / To make for Yourself a glorious [xref]a[/xref]name.

[xref]a[/xref]Look down from heaven, / And see from the habitation of Your holiness and Your beauty: / Where are Your zeal and Your mighty acts? / The stirring of Your inward parts / And Your compassions are restrained toward me.

For You are our [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Father, / Since Abraham does not know us, / And Israel does not acknowledge us. / You, Jehovah, are our Father; / Our [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]Redeemer from eternity is Your name.
verse.note: This verse in Isaiah's prophecy, along with [link]64:8[/link], is a further development of what Isaiah prophesied concerning Christ as the Eternal Father in [link]9:6[/link]. In this verse Christ as the Eternal Father is the Redeemer ([link]Titus 2:13-14[/link]; [link]1 Pet. 1:18-19[/link]), and in [link]64:8[/link] He is the Creator ([link]John 1:3[/link]; [link]Heb. 1:10[/link]).

verse.text: Why, O Jehovah, do You cause us to wander from Your ways / [i]And[/i] harden our hearts so that we do not fear You? / Return for the sake of Your servants, / The tribes of Your inheritance.
Your holy people have possessed Your sanctuary for a little while; / Our adversaries have trodden it down.
We have become [i]like[/i] those over whom You have never ruled, / [i]Like[/i] those who have not been called by Your name.
Oh that You would rend the [xref]a[/xref]heavens, that You would [note]1[/note]come down — / That the mountains would [xref]b[/xref]shake at Your presence —
verse.note: [link]Isaiah 64:1-5a[/link] and [link]66:15-16[/link] reveal the second coming of Christ as the Servant of Jehovah (cf. [link]31:4-5[/link]). Christ's rending the heavens and coming down refers to the consummation of Christ's coming from heaven to earth, from God to man (see note [link]1[sup]1[/sup], pars. 2 and 3, in ch. 61[/link]).

verse.text: Like fire that kindles brushwood, / [i]Like[/i] fire that causes water to boil, / To make Your name known to Your adversaries, / [i]That[/i] the nations may tremble at Your presence!
When You did awesome things that we did not expect, / You came down, the mountains shook at Your presence.
For from of old, [i]men[/i] have not [xref]a[/xref]heard, / Nor perceived with the ear, / Neither has eye seen a God besides You, / Who acts for him who [xref]b[/xref]waits for Him.

You meet him who rejoices and does [xref]a[/xref]righteousness, / Those who remember You in Your ways. / Yes, You were angry, for we sinned; / [i]We have been[/i] in them for a long time, and shall we be saved?

For all of us became like him who is unclean, / And all [xref]a[/xref]our righteousnesses are like a [xref]b[/xref]soiled garment; / And we all wither like a leaf, / And our iniquities, like the wind, carry us away.

And there is no one who [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]calls upon Your name, / Who stirs himself up to [xref]b[/xref]lay hold of You; / For You have [xref]c[/xref]hidden Your face from us / And have [note]2[/note]consumed us by our iniquities.
verse.note: See note [link]21[sup]1[/sup] in Acts 2[/link].
Some ancient versions, perhaps relying on a different MS, translate, delivered us because of. Some modern versions follow this rendering.

verse.text: But now, Jehovah, You are our [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Father; / We are the [xref]b[/xref]clay; and You, our Potter; / And all of us are the work of Your hand.
verse.note: See note [link]16[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 63[/link].

verse.text: Do not be angry to an extreme, O Jehovah, / Neither remember iniquity forever; / Look now, we pray: We all are Your people.
Your holy cities have become a wilderness; / Zion is a wilderness, / [xref]a[/xref]Jerusalem a desolation.
Our holy and beautiful [xref]a[/xref]house, / Where our fathers praised You, / Is burned with fire; / And all the things that we delighted in have become a ruin.
Will You restrain Yourself from these, O Jehovah? / Will You keep silent and afflict us to an extreme?

[xref]a[/xref]I let Myself be inquired of by those who did not ask [i]for Me,[/i] / And found by those who did not seek Me. / I said, Here I am; here I am; / To a nation that was not called by My name.
[xref]a[/xref]I have stretched out My hands all day long / To a rebellious people, / Who walk in a way that is not good, / After their own thoughts;
A people who provoke Me to anger / To My face continually, / Who sacrifice in gardens / And burn incense upon the bricks;
Who sit among the graves / And lodge overnight in the secret places; / Who eat swine's flesh / And the broth of abominations in their pots;
Who say, Keep to yourself, / Do not come near me; for I am holier than you. / These are smoke in My nose, / A fire that burns all day.
It is written here before Me: / I will not keep silent without first recompensing; / And I will recompense, into their bosom,

Your iniquities and the [xref]a[/xref]iniquities of your fathers together, / Says Jehovah, / Who have burned incense upon the mountains / And have scorned Me upon the hills; / Therefore I will measure their work first / Into their bosom.

Thus says Jehovah, / As the new wine is found in the cluster, / And someone says, Do not destroy it, / For there is a blessing in it; / So will I do for My servants' sake, / In order not to destroy them all.
And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, / And out of Judah one who will possess My mountain; / And My [xref]a[/xref]chosen ones will possess it, / And My servants will dwell there.
And Sharon will be an abode for the flock, / And the valley of Achor a resting place for the herd, / For My people who have sought Me.
But you who forsake Jehovah, / Who forget My holy mountain, / Who prepare a [xref]a[/xref]table to Fortune / And fill [i]vessels[/i] with drink offerings to Destiny,

I will destine you to the sword, / And you all will bow down to the slaughter; / Because I called you, but you did not answer; / I spoke, but you did not listen; / But you did evil in My sight / And chose that in which I did not delight.

Therefore thus says the Lord Jehovah, / Indeed, My servants shall eat, / But you shall [xref]a[/xref]hunger; / Indeed, My servants shall drink, / But you shall thirst; / Indeed, My servants shall rejoice, / But you shall be put to shame;
Indeed, My servants shall give a ringing shout / Because of a heart of joy, / But you shall cry out / Because of a heart of pain, / And because of a broken spirit you shall wail.
And you will leave your name as a curse to My chosen ones, / And the Lord Jehovah will slay you; / And He will call His servants by another name,

So that he who blesses himself in the earth / Will bless himself in the [note]1[/note]God of [xref]a[/xref]faithfulness, / And he who swears in the earth / Will swear by the God of faithfulness; / Because the former troubles are forgotten / And because they are hidden from My sight.
verse.note: Lit., the God of Amen (twice in this verse); "i.e., the God who turns what He promises into Yea and Amen ([link]2 Cor. 1:20[/link])" (Keil and Delitzsch). See note [link]20[sup]3[/sup] in 2 Cor. 1[/link].

verse.text: For I am now creating [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]new heavens / And a new earth, / And the [xref]b[/xref]former things will not be remembered, / Nor will they [xref]c[/xref]come up in the heart.
verse.note: According to [link]v. 17[/link] and [link]66:22-24[/link], the restoration of Israel and of all things brought in by Christ as the Servant of Jehovah consummates in the new heaven and new earth. After so many things have passed away, what will remain will be the new heaven and new earth with the New Jerusalem ([link]2 Pet. 3:10-13[/link]; [link]Rev. 21:1-2[/link]).[br][br]In the millennial kingdom the Jews will be priests on the earth ([link]2:2-3[/link]; [link]Zech. 8:20-23[/link]), and the overcoming believers will be priests in the heavens ([link]Rev. 20:6[/link]). At that time the holy city, New Jerusalem, will comprise only the overcoming Old Testament and New Testament saints but not the Israelites who will be saved at the Lord's coming back. At the end of the millennium Satan will stir up opposers, mainly from Gog and Magog, to attack the camp of the Jews and the city of the saints, but fire will come down out of heaven to devour them ([link]Rev. 20:9[/link]). In the new heaven and new earth after the millennium, the Jews who were saved at the coming of the Lord Jesus will be mingled with the New Jerusalem. Therefore, in the new heaven and new earth, there will be only two peoples. First, there will be the New Jerusalem, composed of both the New Testament believers and the Old Testament saints ([link]Rev. 21:12[/link], [link]14[/link]), who will be God's sons as the royal family to rule over the nations and as the priests to serve God forever ([link]Rev. 21:7[/link]; [link]22:3[/link], [link]5[/link]), and second, there will be the nations, who will not be regenerated but only restored and who will live on the new earth outside the New Jerusalem to be God's people ([link]Rev. 21:3[/link], [link]24-26[/link]; [link]22:2b[/link]).

verse.text: [note]1[/note]But rejoice and exult forever, / In what I create, / For I am now creating Jerusalem as an exultation / And her people as a rejoicing.
verse.note: [link]Verses 18-25[/link] reveal that a restoration will be brought in both to Israel and to all things. In this restoration death will be limited, and there will be abundant life and much praise and rejoicing.

verse.text: And I will exult in Jerusalem / And rejoice in My people; / And there will no longer be heard in her / The voice of [xref]a[/xref]weeping and the voice of crying.

There will no longer be in her / An infant [i]who reaches the age of only[/i] a few days / Nor an old man who does not fill up his days; / For the lad will die at a hundred years of age, / And the sinner, being a hundred years of age, will be cursed.
And they will build houses and inhabit [i]them,[/i] / And they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

They will not build and another inhabit; / They will not plant and another eat; / For like the days of a [xref]a[/xref]tree are the days of My people, / And My chosen ones will enjoy the work of their hands to the full;
They will not labor in vain, / Nor bear children unto turmoil; / For they are the seed of those blessed of Jehovah, / And their offspring with them.
And it will be that before they call, I will answer; / Even while they are speaking, I will hear.

[note]1[/note]The [xref]a[/xref]wolf and the lamb will feed as one, / And the lion will eat straw like the ox, / And [xref]b[/xref]dust will be the serpent's food; / They will not harm nor destroy / In all My holy mountain, says Jehovah.
verse.note: The expressions here are very similar to those in [link]11:6-9[/link], which also speaks of the restoration brought in through Christ. See note [link]6[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 11[/link].

verse.text: Thus says Jehovah, / [xref]a[/xref]Heaven is My throne, / And the earth the [xref]b[/xref]footstool for My feet. / Where then is the [note]1[/note]house that you will build for Me, / And where is the place of My rest?
verse.note: See note [link]49[sup]1[/sup] in Acts 7[/link]. God did not consider either heaven or earth His dwelling place, nor did He consider the physical house, the temple, built for Him by the children of Israel the place of His rest. In the Old Testament both the tabernacle and the temple were only symbols of God's union with the children of Israel, whom God considered His actual house ([link]Heb. 3:6[/link] and note). God was united with the children of Israel and became one entity with them, and this one entity was a spiritual house in which both God and the godly people in Israel dwelt ([link]Psa. 27:4[/link]; [link]84:10[/link]; [link]90:1[/link]; cf. [link]1 Pet. 2:5a[/link]). According to [link]v. 2[/link] and [link]57:15[/link], the dwelling place God desires to have is a group of people into whom He can enter. God intends to have a dwelling place in the universe that is the mingling of God and man, in which God is built into man and man is built into God, so that God and man, man and God, can be a mutual abode to each other ([link]John 14:2[/link], [link]20[/link], [link]23[/link]; [link]15:4[/link]; [link]1 John 4:13[/link]). In the New Testament this dwelling place, this house, is the church, which is God's habitation in the believers' spirit ([link]Eph. 2:22[/link] and note 4; [link]1 Tim. 3:15[/link] and note 2). The ultimate manifestation of this universal building, this universal house, is the New Jerusalem. In this city God is in man, taking man as His dwelling place, and man is in God, taking God as His habitation ([link]Rev. 21:3[/link], [link]22[/link], and notes). See note [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in Gen. 28[/link] and notes in [link]2 Sam. 7:12-14[/link].

verse.text: For all these things My hand has made, / And [i]so[/i] all these things have come into being, declares Jehovah. / But to this kind of man will I look, to [i]him who is[/i] [xref]a[/xref]poor / And of a [xref]b[/xref]contrite spirit, and who trembles at My word.

He who kills an ox is [i]like[/i] him who slays a man; / He who sacrifices a lamb, [i]like[/i] him who breaks a dog's neck; / He who offers a meal offering [i]is like him who offers[/i] the blood of swine; / He who burns incense is [i]like[/i] him who blesses an idol. / As surely as they have chosen their own ways, / And their soul delights in their abominations;

Just as surely I will choose what will treat them ill, / And I will bring upon them what they dread; / Because I [xref]a[/xref]called, but no one answered; / I spoke, but they did not listen; / But they did evil in My sight, / And chose that in which I did not delight.

Hear the word of Jehovah, / You who tremble at His word: / Your brothers who hate you, / Who cast you out because of My name, said, / Let Jehovah be glorified / So that we may see your joy. / But they will be put to shame.
A voice of tumult from the city! / A voice from the temple! / The voice of Jehovah giving full / Recompense to His enemies.
Before she travailed, / She brought forth; / Before her pain came, / She gave birth to a man.

Who has heard of such a thing? / Who has seen such things? / Can a land be born in one day? / Or can a nation be brought forth all at once? / For as soon as Zion travailed, / She brought forth her children.
Shall I bring to the point of birth and not cause to bring forth? / Says Jehovah. / Or shall I who cause to bring forth shut [i]the womb?[/i] / Says your God.
Be joyful with Jerusalem and exult for her, / All you who love her; / Rejoice with her in joy, / All you who mourn over her,
So that you may nurse and be satisfied / With her breasts of consolations, / So that you may draw out [i]from her[/i] and take excellent delight / In the abundance of her glory.

For thus says Jehovah, / I now am extending to her / Peace like a [xref]a[/xref]river, / And the [note]1[/note]glory of the nations / Like an overflowing stream; / And you will [xref]b[/xref]nurse, you will be [xref]c[/xref]carried on the hip, / And you will be bounced on the knees.
verse.note: See note [link]13[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 60[/link].

verse.text: As one whom his mother comforts, / So will I comfort you; / And you will be comforted in Jerusalem.

And you will see [i]this,[/i] and your heart will rejoice, / And your [xref]a[/xref]bones will flourish like new grass; / And the hand of Jehovah will be made known to His servants, / And He will be indignant toward His enemies.
For behold, Jehovah will come with [xref]a[/xref]fire, / And His chariots will be like a whirlwind, / To render His anger with fury / And His rebuke with flames of fire.
For with fire Jehovah will execute judgment, / And with His [xref]a[/xref]sword, upon all flesh; / And those slain by Jehovah will be many.

Those who sanctify and purify themselves for the gardens, / Following after one in the midst, / Eating swine's flesh / And what is abominable and [i]even[/i] mice, / Will come to an end together, declares Jehovah.
But [note]1[/note]I — their works and their thoughts [i]I will repay;[/i] the time is coming to gather all the nations and tongues; and they will come and see My glory.
verse.note: The meaning of the Hebrew text is quite obscure.

verse.text: And I will set a sign among them and will send those who have escaped from them unto the nations: [i]to[/i] Tarshish, Put, and Lud, [i]to[/i] those who draw the bow; [i]to[/i] Tubal and [note]1[/note]Javan, [i]to[/i] the distant coastlands that have not heard My fame nor seen My glory; and they will declare My glory among the nations.
verse.note: I.e., Greece.

verse.text: And they will [xref]a[/xref]bring all your brothers from all the nations as a [note]1[/note]meal offering to Jehovah, on horses and in chariots and in wagons and on mules and on camels, to My holy mountain, Jerusalem, says Jehovah, just as the children of Israel bring their meal offering in a clean vessel to the house of Jehovah.
verse.note: In the restoration the nations will bring the scattered Israelites as a meal offering to God. Just as in the ancient time, some of the Israelites will be appointed to serve as priests (cf. [link]61:6[/link]), and others will do the Levitical service ([link]v. 21[/link]).

verse.text: And I will also take some of them for [xref]a[/xref]priests [i]and[/i] for Levites, says Jehovah.
For as the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]new heavens / And new earth, which I make, / Remain before Me, declares Jehovah, / So will your seed and your name remain.
verse.note: See note [link]17[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 65[/link].

verse.text: And from new moon to new moon / And from Sabbath to Sabbath / All flesh will [xref]a[/xref]come / To bow down before Me, says Jehovah.

Then they will go forth and look / On the carcasses of the men that have transgressed against Me; / For their [xref]a[/xref]worm will not die, / Nor will their [xref]b[/xref]fire be quenched; / And they will be an abhorrence to all flesh.
